Human aging is a complex biological process that occurs as we get older. Our bodies undergo many changes that can affect how we look and feel. At birth, our cells are healthy and can reproduce quickly. As we age, our cells start to slow down and eventually die. This is a natural part of life, but it can also increase the risk of certain diseases. To understand human aging, we need to study the way our cells work and how they respond to changes over time. By doing this, we can learn more about what happens as we age and how we can stay healthy for as long as possible. This will help us develop new treatments and therapies to slow down or prevent the effects of aging. Overall, understanding human aging is important for improving our quality of life and increasing our lifespan.
